summary: Chris Evans to star in Apple series 'Defending Jacob'
title: Chris Evans to star in Apple series 'Defending Jacob'
body:
Chris Evans to star in Apple series ‘Defending Jacob’

Los Angeles:

“Avengers: Infinity War” star Chris Evans has signed on to play the lead in Apple miniseries “Defending Jacob”.

The thriller series, to be directed by “The Imitation Game” helmer Morten Tyldum, is based on the novel of the same name by William Landay, reported Variety.

The 37-year-old actor will play Andy Barber, a district attorney who finds that his teenage son is a suspect in the…

summary: Hey there! Love your stories! Would you be able to do Tony and trying to pay attention to important information? :)
question: Hey there! Love your stories! Would you be able to do Tony and trying to pay attention to important information? :)
answer:
This one floated in my head last night so it only took like 25 minutes to write. I hope you like it! 

Here’s the bingo card! Here’s my bingo card!

And if you like my fics and want to support me, you can do so by tossin’ a dollar or two my way here!

Tony blinked hard, sitting with his elbows on his knees in the Quinjet and desperately trying to focus on Steve through all the white noise. Was the jet about to blow up, or was he having a panic attack? It sounded like he was listening through a blizzard. Making his ears work harder than they should was making his head throb, which was not what he needed right now.

“—Right, Tony?” someone asked, he couldn’t hear well enough to recognize the voice but he forced his doubling vision to come together for long enough to see that it was Clint Barton who had nudged him in the ribs with his elbow.

“Ow,” Tony complained, hoping that maybe that would be enough to distract them from discovering that he was totally spacing out. God, he was really fucking cold.

“Okay…” So it was Steve talking, he figured out before his eyes slipped back into their hazy, glassy resting state, “…questions?”

Tony had a lot of questions, but most of them could be umbrella-ed under an eloquent, “yeah, what?”

“Which part?” Steve asked, and Tony shook his head, feeling like the motion might send him tumbling out of his seat altogether if he didn’t hang onto something. The armchair of his seat was something.

Something Clint’s arm was already occupying.

“Excuse you,” he squawked, tugging his arm away from the sudden groping.

“All’v’it,” Tony slurred, and though he could practically watch the pole shove itself farther up Steve’s ass in his outraged posture at his lack of listening skills, the hands that grabbed his shoulders were gentle.

“Something’s not right,” Clint announced, turning Tony toward him and cupping his face in his palm, expecting but not finding heat. He straightened Tony’s arms out in front of him and put his own hands on top of Tony’s upward-facing flat ones. “Tony, push against my hands,” he instructed, sighing in relief when he was met with equal resistance on both sides.

“What’s wrong with him?” Steve asked, already hovering. He handed Clint a water bottle from the refrigerator, because water always helped, right? Thor returned from the front with now-solemn posture.

“I’ve alerted the pilot of a need to land as soon as possible,” he said softly, and apparently Tony had skipped the scene in which Clint had gone to medical school and the others had become first-responders, or more likely he’d zoned out again through the Avengers panic-planning a best-guess response.

“Does your head hurt again?” Clint asked, his voice low and close to Tony’s ear. It did, so he said so. “Damn,” Clint cursed, “a migraine?”

It hadn’t really occurred even to Tony, in his migraine-muddled brain, but that was exactly what was happening. He gave a thumbs up, then held up nine fingers and Clint’s eyes went wide. He’d never seen Tony admit to past a six or a seven on the pain scale, so he must be in really bad shape.

Steve came back with an airplane eye mask to block out the light.

“Can we not call Dr. Strange?” Thor asked, distressed by the whimper Tony let out when Clint tried to move his head just enough to get the mask on. “He can teleport.”

“Yeah, but we’re moving, so unless he times it perfectly, he’ll end up getting ground into sausage in the jet engines,” Clint pointed out, and Tony grimaced.

“Can we not?” he asked, barely managing to separate his words enough to be intelligible.

“Sorry,” Clint apologized sheepishly. “You have any of your pain meds on the jet?”

Tony wanted to roll his eyes, but that was a bad idea, and they wouldn’t be able to see him anyway (not that that would normally stop him). “Yeah, I’m an addictive personality who keeps opioids in his work vehicle,” he snapped. A bit of clarity was beginning to come to him with the marginal relief from the darkness, but now he was bitchy.

“Well when you phrase it like that, it sounds EXACTLY like something you’d do,” Clint snarked back, earning a middle finger from Tony.

“We’ll land soon, anyway,” Steve intervened, “and I’ll make sure SHIELD has something waiting for him.

“Gotta be IV,” Tony added, “otherwise it’ll come back up.”

Steve nodded and included that information in his text to Fury, then helped Tony to recline his seat and took the ice pack Thor had found and pressed it to Tony’s hand, where he wedged it behind his neck.

“Thanks,” he breathed, and though he was too tired to express it, it was aimed toward all of them.

“Just get some sleep,” Clint instructed, “and warn us next time.”

Tony would try.

summary: Okay so I have this theory and I'm not sure of anyone has been thinking about it but it's been keeping me up at night and I need...
body:
Okay so I have this theory and I’m not sure of anyone has been thinking about it but it’s been keeping me up at night and I need to express it. Okay so in Infinity war, Strange told Stark that he wouldn’t hesitate to let him or Peter die for the stone but y'all know how that went down and as Strange was bout to fucking disappear into thin fucking air, he told Stark it was the only way? Okay so you know how Strange went to look at all the future possibilities and found out it was like 14 million and they only won one? title: My speedster

The last few months he abused the hell out of you. He actually raped you, hit you, kicked you. When he didn’t like the food you would cook, he would even lay your hand on the hot pan, burning it. You looked at the scar at the inside of your hand and clenched your fist. How could you be so stupid to stay with the guy?! Finally today you saw the light and told him how you were thinking. Ofcourse he didn’t like it and beat the crap out of you. So right now you were sitting on a bench, in the snow, in only a thick sweater. However, the cold made the bruises a little less painfull. You touched your eye, which was a deep purple by now and winced. That did hurt more than you expected. You now did start to feel cold and tried to think of where you could go. Maybe Wanda? Well, you thought she would be out or busy with Vision. Maybe Pietro? You sighed. That would be so awkward. You had a thing for him for so long now and you couldn’t bare to be around him, without touching him. You always thought he didn’t feel the same, which was the reason you started something with your ex, not knowing what you were up to. You took your phone out and looked up his number. Though you hasitated to call him. Something was pulling you towards him, but at the same time, you didn’t want to disturb him. He was a ladies man and liked to flirt. Maybe he was with some girl right now. After all it had been months since you two last spoke. You bit your lip and pushed the call button, before bringing your phone to your ear.

“Hello?” Pietro said when answering the call. You felt a little warmer by just hearing his voice. “H-hi, it’s me..” you whispered. “y/n? Is that you?” he asked. You shivered at his accent. You always had a weakness for that. “Y-yeah.” you simply replied. “Are you okay? You never call without a reason, what’s wrong?” he asked, worry sounding in his voice. Finally you broke down crying and sobbing. “He…I…” you tried to speak, but the crying was just too much. “Where are you?” he asked sternly. “Park.” you whimpered. The next thing you heard was him hanging up. You put your phone away, thinking he didn’t even wanna talk you to. You buried your face into your hands and kept on crying loudly, not caring if anyone would hear you. Even though it was dark outside and it was late, there were still people everywhere. A wind suddenly went across you and you shivered, wrapping your arms around yourself. When you looked up, you saw a blue hue, gasping as you recognized it right away. Then Pietro stopped right in front of you, kneeling down. “What happened to you?!” he nearly yelled. You turned your head and looked away. Right now your eyes were red and puffy, along with the black eye. He laid his hand under your chin, pulling it in his direction, making you look at him. You looked into those blue eyes and bit your lips. “What did he do to you?” he growled. “H-he hit me…” you whimpered softly. Pietro balled his fists. He then sighed, trying to calm himself down and sat beside you. “Are you cold?” he asked. You nodded. Immediately he took off his coat and wrapped it around you and took you in his arms. “Tell me everything, printsessa.” he said softly. You smiled softly at the old nickname he gave you and felt a little better already.

“The last few months he started to become agressive. At first he would only hit me occasionally. Then he would throw me around the house, off the stairs of lock me up in the bathroom or basement. Then he started burning me with his cigarettes or he would burn my hands on the pans I was cooking in. And the last few days he kept on hitting me several times a day and caused bruises all over my body. And a few minutes ago he hit my eye after I told him off and he should stop. Then he threw me out and I have nowhere to go.” you told and started crying again. You could hear how Pietro’s nostrils were flared and how he was grunting in anger. He held your close and rocked you back and forth. Finally you calmed down and sighed. “So tired..” you whispered. He stood up and picked you up in his arms bridal style. You leaned your head into the crook of his neck and then everything was a blur. Everything you saw was a blue flash and before you knew it you were being laid on his bed. You blinker in surprise. “Pietro, I can’t ask you for this.” you said softly, but did curl up into the covers. “You don’t have to, Printsessa. Stay as long as you need. Or better, live here.” he said, his accent a little thicker as he seemed nervous. You looked at him with wide eyes. “But..” you said, but were interrupted by him. “Just stay. I will protect you from that pridurok.” he said. You nodded. “Please, join me?” you asked timidly. You didn’t want to be alone. “Are you sure?” he asked and raised an eyebrow. You nodded again. He took off his shirt and you practically drooled at the sight. Hell, you stopped loving your ex months ago, so it felt good to be in love again after all this shit. He joined you under the covers and laid behind you. You crawled backwards, till your body hit his and he wrapped his arms around you. You didn’t dare looking at him right now, as your heart was going crazy. “Goodnight, Pietro. Thank you so much.” you whispered. “It’s okay, Printsessa. Vse budet v poryadke. Everything will be alright.” he answered. With that you fell asleep at his warmth and the masculine smell of him on his pillows.

You smiled brightly and looked around, seeing Pietro still asleep. You turned around carefully as he still had his arms around you. He looked so peaceful. You kept smiling and reached up to softly caress his cheek with your fingertips. Even though it had a scruff, it was still so soft. You looked at his lips and couldn’t help but imagine how it would be to feel them against your own. You softly cupped his cheek and caressed his lower lip with your thumg. Your own lips parted in surprise at how soft it felt. You felt your cheeks heat up. You sighed. “God, how was I so stupid? I wish I could tell you how much I love you.
